result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony J Inzeo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property-Special Facts, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Credit For Time Served 104 Days, If Revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Cost and Surcharge to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit Random Urine Screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
DNA Sample to be provided, if not yet previously done.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 12, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Anthony J Inzeo in court, in custody, with Attorney Jorge R Fragoso.   Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Fragoso requests bail modification/reduction and makes statements regarding such request.  State objects to any bail reduction.  Court denies request.      Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Anthony J Inzeo in court, in custody, with attorney Reisha Mitchell for attorney Jorge R Fragoso.   Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Attorney Mitchell requests a bail modification.  State allows an argument.  State objects to a bail modification.   The Court denied the Motion to Modify Bail.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 7, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
